title: ‘Veblen’ Review: Scourge of the Elites
sub_head: His critique of wealth struck a chord in a progressive era, and to some still does.
body: Thorstein Veblen may be the most important American thinker most Americans have never heard of. A prolific economist at the turn of the 20th century, Veblen’s groundbreaking work on the mysteries of inequality earned him the admiration of his academic peers, while his searing observations about the “conspicuous consumption” and “predatory” habits of the wealthy won him an audience far beyond the ivory tower.
